1.reason_for_referral: Severe angina, left main coronary artery disease
1.hpi: Patient presents with chronic angina, worsening over the past 3 months. Non-responsive to medical management.
1.social_etoh: Retired, lives with spouse, occasional alcohol use, non-smoker
1.exam_veins: Veins are normal, no visible varicosities or thrombosis
1.exam_allen_test: Negative for both radial and ulnar patency
1.cxr: No acute lung pathology, cardiomegaly present.

2.surgical_plan: Plan for coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG) involving left internal mammary artery (LIMA) to LAD and saphenous vein graft to RCA.
2.fu_flag: Follow-up readiness confirmed, no complications post-op
2.my_role: Senior resident assisting in bypass graft placement and surgical closure
2.post_op_course: Stable in the ICU, extubated 6 hours post-op, no arrhythmias or complications.
2.learning_points: Close monitoring of hemodynamics during CPB; careful handling of the left internal mammary artery for grafting.
